result.execSummary:
The defendant Jason T Gerbing was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Jason T Gerbing is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Jason T Gerbing was found guilty of Fin.Trans.Card-Fraud. Use >$5000-$10,000, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.41(5)(a)1a.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Fines, costs, and restitution are due during term of supervision.   
The restitution amount listed reflects an additional Administrative Cost of 10% of the amount of restitution pursuant to Section 973.06(1)(g).  The 5% Restitution Surcharge is equal to 5% of the total of the restitution, costs, attorney fees, and fines, pursuant to Section 973.20(11)(a).

Defendant to participate in drug and/or alcohol counseling and treatment deemed appropriate by DOC and to pay all costs of treatment.
Submit to DNA sample and pay surcharge.

Not to possess or consume controlled substances or prescription medication w/out a valid prescription.
  Court orders absolute sobriety.  No possession/consumption of any intoxicants.

-Any prescription medications to remain in original containers.
-Inform agent of any prescriptions ordered.
-Create a payment plan with agent and submit a copty to the court within 60 days.

timeConds.notes: Defendant is granted privileges set forth in Wis Stats 303.08

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

superMiscConds.notes: Fines, costs, and restitution are due during term of supervision.  Dept of Corrections to collect the maximum amount or percentage from defendant's wages and from other monies held in the defendant's inmate account. If defendant is released with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment enforceable by all creditors' remedies shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  State advises complaint not returned and requests warrant. Court finds probable cause and based on non appearnce forfeits bail and issues warrant.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea
